model.name: Mark and Toys
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
function maxiumumToys($prices, $k) {
    // Complete this function
}

fscanf($handle, "%i %i", $n, $k);
$prices_temp = fgets($handle);
$prices = explode(" ",$prices_temp);
$prices = array_map('intval', $prices);
$result = maximumToys($prices, $k);
echo $result . "\n";

?>
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

def maxiumumToys(prices, k)
    # Complete this function
end

n, k = gets.strip.split(' ')
n = n.to_i
k = k.to_i
prices = gets.strip
prices = prices.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
result = maximumToys(prices, k)
puts result
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n_t = words n_temp
    let n = read $ n_t!!0 :: Int
    let k = read $ n_t!!1 :: Int
    prices_temp <- getLine
    let prices = map read $ words prices_temp :: [Int]

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview:
You are Mark's best friend and have to help him buy as many
 toys as possible.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
    let [
      n_temp (read-line) 
      n_t (split n_temp #"\s+") 
      n (Integer/parseInt (n_t 0)) 
      k (Integer/parseInt (n_t 1)) 
    ]

  (
    let [
      prices_temp (read-line) 
      prices_t (split prices_temp #"\s+") 
      prices (map #(Integer/parseInt %) prices_t) 
    ]
  )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N,K]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
    Prices = read_array(N,"~d"),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
function maxiumumToys(prices, k)
    -- Complete this function

n,k = io.read("*number", "*number", "*l")
prices = {}
prices_temp = io.read()
prices_i = 1
for token in string.gmatch(prices_temp, "[^%s]+") do
	prices[prices_i] = token
	prices_i = prices_i + 1
end
model.body_html:
Mark and Jane are very happy after having their first kid. Their son is very fond of toys, so Mark wants to buy some. There are different toys lying in front of him, tagged with their prices, but he has only . He wants to maximize the number of toys he buys with this money.

Now, you are Mark's best friend and have to help him buy as many toys as possible.

Input Format

The first line contains two integers, and , followed by a line containing space separated integers indicating the products' prices.

Constraints




A toy can't be bought multiple times.

Output Format

An integer that denotes maximum number of toys Mark can buy for his son.

Sample Input

7 50
1 12 5 111 200 1000 10

Sample Output

4

Explanation

He can buy only 4 toys at most. These toys have the following prices: 1,12,5,10.
